organizations.Description: 1871 is a private collective of trailblazing founders, visionary leaders, resilient innovators, and steadfast supporters in tech. Immerse in our programs, resources, and community uniquely designed for growing a vibrant tech ecosystem.
Chicago's first Business incubator focused on the development of entrepreneurs in entertainment, creative industries, & Lifestyle Brands.

Welcome to the Chicago 3D Printing Meetup Group! This group is for anyone interested in Computer Aided Design, 3D Modeling, and Tools for 3D printing. Whether you're a beginner looking to learn more about the technology or a seasoned pro wanting to network with like-minded individuals, this meetup is for you. Join us for workshops, hands-on demonstrations, and discussions about the latest advancements in the world of 3D printing. Let's come together to share our knowledge, ideas, and passion for this cutting-edge technology.

Attendee/Member note: This meetup group, its discussion threads, and its events are for startup founders (current or prospective). Unaffiliated recruiters and/or people otherwise trying to solicit sales (e.g. promoting/selling products or services) from attendees may be asked to leave the group/event.

2Flo Ventures is a startup studio and venture capital firm dedicated to accelerating equitable innovation in healthcare. We invest in diverse healthcare entrepreneurs and support companies to close gaps in health outcomes for underserved communities.

2Flo Ventures is a startup studio and venture capital firm dedicated to accelerating equitable innovation in healthcare. We invest in diverse healthcare entrepreneurs and support companies to close gaps in health outcomes for underserved communities.

Hello!

Welcome to 312Coders, a vibrant coding community focused on bringing local developers together! We host monthly tech happy hours at local breweries.

All are welcome, whether you're just starting out, a bootcamp graduate, a coding enthusiast, a part- or full-time developer, job-seeking, or still hitting the books. Come hang with one of the best tech communities in Chicago!

The purpose of this group is to share exciting science and technology use cases around various Engineering, Data Science, and other Technology topics occurring at 84.51°. Our goal is to network and collaborate within our local data science, engineering, and technology professionals!

8th Light University is a virtual event series managed by 8th Light Inc, a global team of software, design, and technology professionals. We share what we know — from technical deep dives to exploratory panel discussions. Topics vary greatly, but are always focused on improving the quality of software design and development. Software professionals of all skill levels are welcome!

organizations.Organization: ACE (Architecture, Construction, Engineering) Mentor Program Chicago
organizations.Description: ACE is a unique partnership among industry professionals – architects, interior designers, engineers, construction managers, college and university representatives, and other affiliated organizations- who work together to attract young people to their professions.

AI2030 is a member-based initiative aiming to harness the transformative power of AI to benefit humanity while minimizing its potential negative impact. Focused on Responsible AI, AI for All, and AI for Good, we aim to bridge awareness, talent, and resource gaps, enabling responsible AI adoption across public and private sectors.

Welcome aboard the AI at Work Chicago group! An extension of the thriving Columbus AI at Work community, our mission is to journey deep into the captivating universe of Artificial Intelligence, with a distinct focus on Generative AI. We are launching an enlightening series of 12 meetups throughout the year, where we'll delve into a variety of AI models, concentrating on their practical implications and applications in addressing modern business challenges.

AI Tinkerers is a meetup designed exclusively for practitioners who possess technical, machine learning, and entrepreneurial backgrounds and are actively building and working with foundation models, such as large language models (LLMs) and generative AI. If you’re deeply passionate about creating LLM-enabled applications, have hands-on experience in building such systems, and are eager to connect with like-minded individuals who share your level of commitment, then this group is the perfect fit for you. With AI Tinkerers meetups taking place in multiple cities, we cater to a dedicated community of practitioners.

AIChE is the world's leading organization for chemical engineering professionals, with more than 60,000 members from more than 110 countries. AIChE has the breadth of resources and expertise you need whether you are in core process industries or emerging areas, such as translational medicine.

ANS is made of people who are enthusiastic and passionate about the benefits of nuclear science and technology, whether they are nuclear professionals or not. The Chicago local section serves a large area and we focus on having technical dinner meetings to enrich the professional development of those in the field and to foster networks that may not otherwise occur. We hosted ANS NURETH-16 in 2015 and the ANS National meeting in 2012.

organizations.Organization: American Public Works Association (APWA) - Chicago Chapter
American Society of Heating, Refrigeration, and Air Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE)

organizations.Description:
Analytics Lounge is a 501(c)(3) community lab dedicated to:

    Providing an environment in which we host discussions related to chemistry, engineering, biology, manufacturing and entrepreneurship.
    Providing a shared space and access to test, measurement, prototyping, and analysis equipment.
    Providing an informal environment that encourages teaching and learning in the spirit of self-directed education, and encourages not just citizen science, but citizen-led science.
    Recycling used and unwanted lab equipment.

Artifice is a Woodlawn-based organization that uses project-based, hands-on learning to endow participants with the tech and entrepreneurial skills that will make them the masters of their own destiny. Since 2013, we've worked to combine tech and entrepreneurial competencies in a way that will sustainably raise the economic and educational prospects of the neighborhood and surrounding areas.

AWE Nite Chicago is a place for developers, creators, investors, founders, corporate decision makers and curious folk to come together to celebrate the activity and devote conviction around building an augmented reality (AR) hub in Chicago.

This AWS user group is a user-run, user-focused community in Chicago. We hold monthly, free events open to all levels of AWS users. We aim for consistent format with user-focused, quality non-sales presentations and discussion.

This group is about bitcoin, open blockchains, decentralization, and innovation. We host three types of regular events, general interest talks, community building socials, and educational events for developers. Whether you are an enthusiast, a professional, or a newbie - we invite you to join our friendly Chicago community!

This meetup will host ongoing events to encompass everything in the Bitcoin economy - from merchant solutions to app development and discussion of mining, security and bitcoin fundamentals! Attendees include developers, miners, entrepreneurs and we almost always have a few newcomers!

Our goal and mission is to “stomp the divide” between Black tech workers and to fundamentally influence and effect change on an industry that has historically not sought parity with respect to Black workers. Our intent is to level the playing field through training, education, networking, and mentorship with the support of allies, partners, sponsors, and most importantly our global members.

organizations.Organization: Blacks United In Leading Technology - Chicago
organizations.Description: Blacks United in Leading Technology - Chicago is the official, chartered chapter for Chicago, Illinois of the dynamic, growing, vibrant Blacks United in Leading Technology International non-profit corporation.

organizations.Organization: BurbSec: Chicagoland’s Largest Information Security Meetups!
organizations.Description: Are you ready to dive headfirst into the vibrant world of InfoSec, surrounded by a squad of tech-savvy enthusiasts, students, hackers, geeks, and all-around cool people? Look no further – Burbsec is THE place to be in the Chicagoland area!

Chi Hack Night is a free, weekly event in Chicago to build, share and learn about tools to create, support, and serve the public good.

We are a group of thousands of designers, academic researchers, data journalists, activists, policy wonks, web developers and curious citizens who want to make our city more just, equitable, transparent and delightful to live in through data, design and technology.

Chi Hack Night is a free, weekly event in Chicago to build, share and learn about tools to create, support, and serve the public good.

We are a group of thousands of designers, academic researchers, data journalists, activists, policy wonks, web developers and curious citizens who want to make our city more just, equitable, transparent and delightful to live in through data, design and technology.

The Chicago Suburban SQL User Group is a place for SQL Server and Data Professionals to learn about and share knowledge on a number of topics related to data. We have both in person and virtual meetings.

Welcome to CHI-NOG. CHI-NOG is the first and the only Chicago based Network Operators Groups. The group was started by network engineers and network architects to create a community, to learn from each other and meet others. We get away from our keyboards and screens to meet in person every year bringing in speakers from all over the US to learn and have a beer with them. CHI-NOG is a vendor neutral conference so we aren’t trying to sell you anything, but you do get a pretty awesome t-shirt each year for attending.

The Go programming language is an open source project to make programmers more productive. Go is expressive, concise, clean, and efficient. Its concurrency mechanisms make it easy to write programs that get the most out of multicore and networked machines, while its novel type system enables flexible and modular program construction. Go compiles quickly to machine code yet has the convenience of garbage collection and the power of run-time reflection. It's a fast, statically typed, compiled language that feels like a dynamically typed, interpreted language.
Join us to learn and practice AI, Machine learning, Deep learning and Data Science technology together with like-minded developers.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Analytics and Data Science in the Cloud
organizations.Description: We started this group to help share how companies and teams are solving the infrastructure and analytical challenges in operationalizing big data workloads (Machine Learning, ETL, and adhoc analytics). Data is everywhere, but getting value requires the right people and technology in place. All skill levels are welcome.

The Chicago Association of Student Engineers is a registered non-profit 501(c)(3) organization open to all high school students across Chicago, for no cost!
 
CASE aims to promote engineering pathways to high schoolers throughout the Chicagoland area by building an enthusiastic STEM community, offering career resources to support students.

BitDevs Chicago is a consensus compatible fork of BitDevs NYC. We discuss bitcoin protocol developments, computer security related to cryptocurrency, and other relevant topics in the cryptocurrency ecosystem

BitDevs Chicago is a consensus compatible fork of BitDevs NYC. We discuss bitcoin protocol developments, computer security related to cryptocurrency, and other relevant topics in the cryptocurrency ecosystem
A Chicago User Group focused on C/C++

We hold monthly meetings, typically in downtown Chicago, with speakers to increase our knowledge about all aspects of Computer Science, and to network with other computing industry professionals, academics, and students.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Chapter of the Illinois Society of Professional Engineers

organizations.Description: A Chicago coding meetup for any dev-curious, aspiring, or professional developer to work/hack on your project. Or learn to code in an afternoon with coffee and cool-inclusive people. All skill levels are welcome. Bring your laptop! Details on individual event pages.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Council on Science and Technology

organizations.Description: We are dedicated to exploring the exciting new world of on-chain digital art / NFTs - with an emphasis on tokenized visual art, computer art, net art, new media, transmedia, generative art, AI art, music, poetry, film, fashion, photography, and performance art - within the context of the greater art sphere. This is a community focused on education and exploration in the Chicago and Chicagoland Area, the Metaverse, Web3, and globally online. Interested in joining the conversation? We look forward to seeing you at the next event!

Welcome to Chicago Cyber Circle, where cybersecurity enthusiasts and professionals come together to share cyber knowledge and network with experts, entrepreneurs, and enthusiasts as we unite to build a safer digital future.
A monthly meetup of Chicago Data Professionals and Amateurs to network, mingle and talk about everything Data!
Welcome Chicago Data Professionals! We are an online and in-person group that hosts live speaking events on a range of topics related, but not limited to, Microsoft Azure Data Services.
With dbt, data analysts and engineers can build analytics the way engineers build applications.
Quarterly gatherings of designers, developers, and designer/developers to share and compare experiences and techniques to deliver effective design systems.

We are an informal, local Chicago digital forensics and eDiscovery group. We often discuss incident response and information security topics. There are no fees or any affiliation required to attend. Anyone interested should come!

Chicagoland Cybersecurity Exchange (formerly Chicago Security Meetup) aims to bring together and serve the Chicagoland cybersecurity community as a hub for thought-provoking discussions, hands-on demos and walk-throughs, memorable gatherings, career opportunities and peer to peer networking.

Comprised of 1,700+ passionate security thinkers, tinkerers, inventors, engineers, architects, analysis, advisors, entrepreneurs and executives, our members are the cybersecurity backbone of Chicago and the organizations that call it home.

Become a part of our CDN community, where we prioritize the holistic development of digital nomads.

We welcome digital nomads, remote workers, wellness enthusiasts, career-driven professionals, and those seeking work-life balance to join us. CDN offers tailored resources and connections to support your journey and facilitate meaningful connections among like-minded individuals.

Welcome to the Chicago Dynamo Community, affectionately known as ChiNamo! We're a vibrant group of Dynamo enthusiasts based in the Chicago area, united by our passion for enhancing building information modeling. Dynamo, in its essence, revolutionizes BIM by melding it with the dynamic data and logic of a graphical algorithm editor. It's the bridge that connects Revit and other BIM tools with a powerful scripting environment, opening a world of possibilities.

This meetup is a great opportunity to network with like-minded professionals and share your insights about the EdTech industry. Whether you're an expert in the field or just curious about the future of education, we welcome you to join us for a couple of hours of engaging discussion. See you there!

The mission of the Chicago Engineers’ Foundation is to encourage and empower young people to become the next generation of engineers through scholarship opportunities, outreach to educational institutions, and promoting interest in engineering careers.

This is a group for anyone interested in building cross-platform mobile applications using Flutter & Dart and for those looking to help build the community around Flutter & Dart. Want to get excited and start building with Flutter? Want to help others get excited? Want to contribute to the Flutter community? Join this group and let's do it!

Chicago Food Tech offers a variety of meetup events to bring together restauranteurs, food and technology changemakers and innovators with diverse backgrounds in order to create dialogues surrounding new business models, showcase opportunities, challenges, synergies, and forecast food technology's future.

Chicago's original Haskell group (circa 2009). The Chicago Haskell group has been meeting, educating (both novice and advanced) and proliferating the practice of functional programming in Haskell throughout Chicagoland and abroad (Idris developers accepted, dependent on their type) for almost seven years. We focus on presentations, getting together and coding, and mentorship around Haskell.

We are a group of indie hackers who are passionate about:
1. Bootstrapping small businesses from side projects
2. Build cool stuff for ourselves and our customers
3. Constantly invent, tinker, and learn

New to Indie Hackers?
Learn more here: https://www.indiehackers.com/start

Since 2014, we’ve been covering, connecting and catalyzing the city's ecosystem, producing digital media, events and intelligence about the entrepreneurs, executives, startups, businesses, trends and topics that are shaping the present and future of Chicago's economy.

The Chicago Java User’s Group is here to help the Java Professional. We want to make Chicago the ‘best’ place to be a Java developer, by offering a support network that allows each individual Java developer to grow! Its only purpose is to serve its community by focusing on three areas: - Learning about the Java Craft - Making a Difference in the Java Community - Growing as a Java Professional

Meet other local JavaScripters to network, share knowledge, to review the state of the art, or to dream up new applications. We are starting to host a few in person meetups, but we will also offer virtual to ensure developers from everywhere can join!

Welcome to the Chicago Kotlin Users group! We are a group of lovely people interested in this fun and new language that is quickly winning popularity on the JVM and spreading to JS and Native. Come join us and learn more about this neat, pragmatic language, the ecosystem surrounding it and what Kotlin can do for you! We hope to have interesting presenters/talks and presentations once a month.

The opinions and actions of the community are independent of the Kotlin team.
The Chicago Lean Startup Circle is a group of smart and driven high-tech entrepreneurs that have learned how to discover customers and build products they want.
Welcome to this group. We are celebrating the world of machine learning.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Machine Learning Paper Reading Group
organizations.Description:
Are you trying to keep up with the flood of AI papers coming out? Have you ever read an AI paper and said, "What the hell type of notation is this?" and want to learn more. Are you simply curious about AI, machine learning, deep learning, GFlowNets, RWKV models, or some other wild thing? Do you have a PhD in math or no degree at all?

Well you've come to the right place! This meetup is all about finding other people crazy enough to try to keep up with AI and the actual research papers that keep popping up on Arxiv. We don't want to dumb things down in our quixotic quest for knowledge, but that also doesn't mean people should be scared away. All we ask is you bring curiosity and whatever math, pytorch, or cs skills you got.

If you're new to machine learning or a seasoned veteran, there are opportunities for you to grow in this community! Consider attending an upcoming meetup, or if you have a topic that you'd like to share with others, consider presenting - there's no experience needed, just your enthusiasm and a topic you think is interesting.
Join us to learn and practice AI, LLMs, ChatGPT, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Data technology together with like-minded developers.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Open Source Data Infrastructure Meetup
organizations.Description: This group aims to bring together data engineers, developers, platform operators, and other enthusiasts to discuss and share the latest trends and best practices in the field of open source technologies, with a special focus on data management, processing, and analytics. We will cover PostgreSQL, Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Cassandra and many many more.

We are a community of Postgres professionals who seek to deepen our understanding of this awesome relational database, explore ways to extend Postgres, build applications atop it, interface it to other databases, and tune it for maximum value. We seek to do this in a casual setting while sharing friendships, food, and - of course - beer. So come, join us and discuss your Postgres experiences and share the tips and tricks you've learned using it.

Chicago Power BI User Group is a business analytics minded group. Focus of the user group is to share experiences with the fast growing features of Power BI. Audience of the user group is business analysts, managers, Excel users... anybody who wants to explore data.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Pre-College Science and Engineering Program (ChiS&E)
organizations.Description: The Chicago Pre-College Science and Engineering Program (ChiS&E) provides highly-engaging, age-appropriate hands-on science and engineering activities for Chicago Public School (CPS) K-12 students and their parents. The program develops student and parent knowledge as well as a love of learning in areas of science, technology, engineering and mathematics.

ChiPMA (Chicago Product Management Association), is about helping Chicago-area product management professionals get better at conceiving, designing, building, launching, and optimizing digital products and services.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Stellar - Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, Fintech Meetup
organizations.Description: Meetings, presentations and discussions about the Stellar blockchain. Aimed at both technical and not technical people, covering all range of subjects including blockchain solutions, decentralization, new payment paradigms, tokenization of assets and more.

Welcome to SatoshiFanClub! Join us to discuss all things related to Blockchain, and we're Blockchain agnostic.

We'll do deep dives and intro on different networks and cryptocurrencies.

Calling all identity and cloud security humans in Chicago!

The Non-Human Identity (NHI) buzz is everywhere 🐝 so it's time to pull back the curtains on this emerging threat and expose everything.

We're on a mission to empower security practitioners to become the go-to experts of NHIs within their organization.

How you're going to become the NHI expert your organization needs:

    Be the first to hear about in-person NHI workshops in Chicago
    Get invited to monthly virtual AMA sessions with industry leaders and influencers
    Network and exchange ideas with fellow security professional in fun events and meetups

Founded in 2003, Chicago Python User Group is one of the world's most active programming language special interest groups with over 1,000 active members and many more prestigious alumni. Our main focus is the Python Programming Language. There are many ways to get and stay involved. Meetings are open to all levels. Our main meetings are on the 2nd Thursday of every month and happen online remotely. We have SIGs (Special Interest Groups) in: Mentorship, Data Science, Web technologies, and Finullce.

The Chicago Quantum Exchange (CQE) is an intellectual hub in the Midwest that connects leading universities, national labs, and industry partners to advance the science and engineering of quantum information, train the future quantum workforce, and drive the quantum economy. The recipient of millions of dollars in government and corporate investment and home to some of the world’s top experts in the field, the CQE community is a central driver of US leadership in quantum technologies.

Join us for regular face-to-face meetups about the R Statistical Programming language! We strive to learn from each other and collaborate to accomplish common goals. For slides and code related to past talks, please checkout our Github page.
To continue the conversation online, join the CRUG Slack channel!

R-Ladies Chicago was founded in July 2017 with the goal of supporting women and gender minorities who use R. Anyone with an interest in R is welcome - our group includes data scientists, career transitioners, academic researchers, industry experts, students, interested individuals, and others. Whether you're a beginner or an expert, we encourage you to attend a monthly Meetup!

This group is focused on bringing together the Chicago Red Hat User Community for business and technical presentations, conversations and perhaps some food and drink. Membership is open to Red Hat customers, partners and people interested in Red Hat technologies.

The Chicago Seleniumistas are Selenium users and QA professionals of all skill levels who discuss and learn together. We host monthly events like lightning talks, tech talks, open office hours, workshops, and ‘contribute to Selenium’ sessions. While we do pride ourselves in our technical Selenium prowess, we also want to progress the dialog around using Selenium to test software and other topics related to testing software. Prove your love of Selenium by joining us and bringing your voice to the table!

The Chicago Snowflake Meetup is an open group that promotes collaboration and connects data experts across the Greater Chicago area. It's the perfect forum for anyone who works in, or has an interest in data, with a focus on Snowflake. Our purpose is to simply learn from each other and continue driving the data community forward.

Chicago Tech & Startup Meetups are broad by design, the goal of this group is to be interactive and allow technology enthusiasts to learn from other professionals, have questions answered in real-time, discover new tech, and hear stories that inspire. This group is a place for technology professionals who wouldn’t normally cross paths to meet, collaborate, and learn about what their peers are doing across the city. To learn more about Chicago Tech & Startup Meetups join our group.
Startup Founder 101 brings together aspiring and experienced tech entrepreneurs to discuss, meet, and collaborate to build great new startups, and to push the local startup ecosystem forward
A space uniting diversity-focused technology groups in Chicago.
A space uniting diversity-focused technology groups in Chicago.
Chicago Unreal Engine Heroes is a place where anyone using UE can get together and share projects, demos, ideas and any fun things they're doing with the engine.

The Chicago Women in Tech Conference (ChiWitCon) is a gathering of women professionals, technologists and innovators from Chicago and beyond. Open to all genders across all platforms, ChiWitCon brings the achievements and professional interests of inspiring individuals across tech to the forefront.

The Chicago Women in Tech Conference (ChiWitCon) is a gathering of women professionals, technologists and innovators from Chicago and beyond. Open to all genders across all platforms, ChiWitCon brings the achievements and professional interests of inspiring individuals across tech to the forefront.

organizations.Organization: Chicago Women UX Designers in Tech
organizations.Description: Working as a designer in tech can be rewarding but also come with its own set of challenges. This group is designed to be a safe space for womxn & allies who work as designers in tech to connect and discuss experiences, challenges and questions about working in the field. Each Meetup surrounds a single theme with smaller breakout discussions. We want to keep these events small, casual, and meaningful. All are welcome to join!

organizations.Organization: Chicago Women UX Designers in Tech
organizations.Description: Working as a designer in tech can be rewarding but also come with its own set of challenges. This group is designed to be a safe space for womxn & allies who work as designers in tech to connect and discuss experiences, challenges and questions about working in the field. Each Meetup surrounds a single theme with smaller breakout discussions. We want to keep these events small, casual, and meaningful. All are welcome to join!

ChicagoRuby is a group of Ruby on Rails enthusiasts with events in Chicago and in the surrounding suburbs. WindyCityRails is Chicago's annual Ruby on Rails conference. Watch the latest WindyCityRails videos. If you're curious about the Internet of Things in Chicago, check out WindyCityThings. ChicagoRuby also collaborates with LinuxBarbados in the beautiful Caribbean nation of Barbados.
ChiTownBio is dedicated to putting the knowledge, skills, and tools of biotechnology into the hands of all Chicagoans who want to explore the living world and use it to benefit our community.

This is a meetup for everybody who is interested in ClickHouse, from a technology and use case perspective. ClickHouse® is an open-source, high performance columnar OLAP database management system for real-time analytics using SQL. The sessions and discussions in this group will relate to architecture considerations, software design, coding and much more.
All those interested in 'Cloud Security' and the continuous changing nature of securing technologies in the Cloud.

Hello!

Welcome to 312Coders, a vibrant coding community focused on bringing local developers together! We host monthly tech happy hours at local breweries.

All are welcome, whether you're just starting out, a bootcamp graduate, a coding enthusiast, a part- or full-time developer, job-seeking, or still hitting the books. Come hang with one of the best tech communities in Chicago!
The Compute Collective is a community of builders working in data, AI, and the cloud computing space to network, learn, and get inspired. Hosted by Saurabh Sharma, Partner at Jump Capital

Couchbase is a distributed, multi-model, NoSQL database for applications that need high-performance storage, replication, and synchronization of data from the cloud, through to offline-first mobile devices. Capella, our database-as-a-service, is the easiest and fastest way to begin with Couchbase.

Welcome! 🎨🤖 Creative AI is a community space to socialize and discuss critically hopeful conversations about the design and use of AI, with an explicit focus on AI's impact on creative disciplines. This includes artists, musicians, technologists, writers, designers, photographers, etc. We share emerging research and trends, and make space for open dialogue across disciplines when it comes to AI. Together, through projects, art, and conversation, we help people understand how they can create with, around, and for AI.

Cyberjam 2024 is an immersive hackathon taking place from October 19th to October 27th at Chicago's global innovation hub, 1871. Teams of 5 (we call them Jammers) will work together on phygital experiences combining art, technology, and innovation across five thematic tracks:

With origins in academia and the open source community, Databricks was founded in 2013 by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. As the world’s first and only lakehouse platform in the cloud, Databricks combines the best of data warehouses and data lakes to offer an open and unified platform for data and AI.

DeAI Chicago is a community of decentralized technology enthusiasts interested in exploring the intersection of web3 and artificial intelligence (AI). Our core mission is to elevate the innovation and development of decentralized AI technologies within Chicago and the Midwest more broadly. Let's come together to learn, collaborate, and shape the future of DeAI.

If you love Rust, or want to learn more about the language and what it means to be "safe": then come chat and explore Rust with us.

All levels of learners are welcome from those knowing little to nothing about programming to those that argue with maintainers on a daily basis!
This is a group of professionals (and hackers), managers, engineers (both dev and ops) and entrepreneurs coming together to learn about and share information on DevOps practices.

Welcome to Discover Technology! We are building amazing products through a focus on people, processes, and technology. Join us here to see how this methodology creates a brighter finullcial future for our customers, and delights our engineers and product leaders. Learn how Discover engineers are shaping the future of finullcial technology — and having fun while they do it!

Led by the University of Illinois System in partnership with top research universities, DPI does three things: train people for high-demand tech jobs, conduct applied R&D, and business building to grow Chicago’s tech ecosystem.

The Chicago Drupal community has a long and proud history as one of the most active and vibrant in all of North America. The mission of the Drupal Chicago is to create an open community among everyone interested in the Drupal open source content management platform.

The Drupal Chicago Meetup Group holds meetups and hopefully provide something of interest to everyone. Presentations and speakers are aimed at a general audience, with site show-and-tells, module demonstrations, news and announcements, and question and answer sessions. If you are new to Drupal, this is a great place to start and continue to learn about new Drupal things.
This Group is for all the professionals who are interested in learning new solutions and technologies in ecommerce. Find out the latest events on emerging commerce technologies.

This group is for anyone interested in making data usable in real-time and at scale for use cases like security, observability, enterprise search, and many more, using our Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats products (https://www.elastic.co/products/).
ETHChicago is a community-run ecosystem on the mission of elevating Web3 innovation and entrepreneurship in the Midwest through education and events.

Coding is essential for helping youth thrive in a future driven by technology.  Everyone should have the opportunity to learn to code.  Launched in 2016, the Everyone Can Code program gives everyone the power to learn, write and teach code using Swift -- a powerful and easy to use programming language created by Apple and embraced by developers and businesses everywhere.
This group will be a place for like-minded founders to take a break from the chaos of their companies to have a beer and discuss those challenges of the grind together.
A global collective of 27,000+ Gen Z VCs, founders, angel investors, operators and aspiring VCs… the future of innovation.
A global collective of 27,000+ Gen Z VCs, founders, angel investors, operators and aspiring VCs… the future of innovation.
GENESIS is the largest community for Gen Z entrepreneurs in the Midwest United States. We put on weekly dinners, massive events, and epic trips all over the world.
GENESIS is the largest community for Gen Z entrepreneurs in the Midwest United States. We put on weekly dinners, massive events, and epic trips all over the world.

Girls 4 Science is a nonprofit organization dedicated to exposing girls in Chicago, ages 10-18 years old, to (STEM) science, technology, engineering and math.

We focus on developing skills, self-esteem, opportunity awareness, as well as relationship building that will help girls overcome barriers that may prevent them from achieving greater success in STEM careers.

Girls 4 Science is a nonprofit organization dedicated to exposing girls in Chicago, ages 10-18 years old, to (STEM) science, technology, engineering and math.

We focus on developing skills, self-esteem, opportunity awareness, as well as relationship building that will help girls overcome barriers that may prevent them from achieving greater success in STEM careers.

The Grafana & Friends Chicago meetup group hosts regular events centered on open source monitoring and observability with Grafana and complementary technologies. Some events feature presentations, while some are more laid back and meant to foster group discussion. Either way, there will be snacks and stickers.

Committed to racial equity and social justice, i.c.stars drives change with education, training and opportunity. We provide underserved young adults with technology-based workforce development, community leadership training, internships and job placement.

Committed to racial equity and social justice, i.c.stars drives change with education, training and opportunity. We provide underserved young adults with technology-based workforce development, community leadership training, internships and job placement.
IEEE is the world’s largest technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology for the benefit of humanity.

organizations.Organization: Illinois Institute of Technology - Armour College of Engineering
Information Systems Audit and Control Association-Chicago Chapter
Information Systems Security Association (ISSA) Chicago Chapter
organizations.Description: The Chicago Chapter of the ISSA has a mission to offer a stimulating combination of discussion forums, hands-on learning, CISSP certification training, conferences, and other events which are designed to enhance understanding and awareness of information security issues for information security professionals.

organizations.Organization: Intellectual Property Law Association of Chicago (IPLAC)

organizations.Description: mHUB is Chicago's innovation center for physical product development and manufacturing. Our 12K sq. ft. prototyping shop consists of 10 labs: Electronics, 3D Printing, Testing, Textiles, Plastics, Woodworking, Wet Lab, Metal Fabrication, Metal Milling Lab/CNC Machine Lab and Laser Cutting. We also provide resources like design and modeling software as well as other resources to help makes build prototypes and turn them into success products and businesses. In addition, we have reserved and part-time co-working office space for our members.
MLOps Community - Chicago is a local meetup that talks about the engineering challenges of deploying and maintaining ML solutions. Join #chicago in our Slack space (https://mlops.community/).

organizations.Organization: National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE) - Chicago
organizations.Description: The vision of the Chicago Professionals chapter is to professionally develop our active members, to prepare our collegiate members in the greater Chicagoland area for the transition from collegiate to professional, and increase the interest in STEM fields and NSBE Jr. participation for African American children in grades K-12.

organizations.Organization: National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE) - Chicago
organizations.Description: The vision of the Chicago Professionals chapter is to professionally develop our active members, to prepare our collegiate members in the greater Chicagoland area for the transition from collegiate to professional, and increase the interest in STEM fields and NSBE Jr. participation for African American children in grades K-12.

NERP is Not Exclusively Raspberry Pi, the small computer and embedded systems interest group at Pumping Station One in Chicago. (Chicago's oldest and finest hackerspace.) NERP is discussion driven. There may or may not be a scheduled speaker or meeting topic. NERP provides a place for learning, discussing, and experimenting with open source hardware and software. Also, electronic sensing and control, general electronics, and early history of computing machines and process control, and the Raspberry Pi and friends, of course. And whatever related topic you want to discuss.

organizations.Organization: Northwestern University - McCormick School of Engineering

organizations.Description: Welcome to the preeminent Chicago meetups for Mac and iOS developers and enthusiasts!

Open Code Chicago is a vibrant open-source community committed to fostering collaboration, innovation, and learning in the tech world. Our mission is to bring together IT enthusiasts of all skill levels—whether you're an experienced developer, a networking enthusiast, or just starting out—to connect, share knowledge, and contribute to meaningful projects.
We provide a dynamic space for growth and discovery, offering opportunities to participate in engaging events, learn from experts, and collaborate on exciting initiatives. Join us to be part of a supportive network dedicated to shaping the future of technology and making a positive impact together.

This is a group for anyone interested in search engineering, open source search technology, and search relevancy in the Chicago area. If you’ve used or are interested in OpenSearch, Elasticsearch, or Solr, you’re in the right place!

Welcome to our community! We're a group of real estate investors, software engineers, product managers, private equity bankers, podcasters, and social media content creators working together in our incubator space OraVew to grow our individual businesses and build relationships that extend our operational capabilities.

organizations.Organization: Out In Tech - Has Chicago chapter

organizations.Description: P33 is committed to reclaiming Chicago's position as the World's Brightest Spot for technological discovery and development. We are a team of thinkers and doers – business and community leaders, entrepreneurs, educators, technology experts and policymakers – who represent today's establishment and tomorrow's vanguard. Our work is focused on the key areas that will drive the future of Chicago's technology leadership: Talent & Education, Capital & Finullce, Business, Community & Culture, and Government & Infrastructure. Together, we're harnessing the spirit of technological innovation that lives in Chicago to drive momentum for businesses, both emerging and established, as well as for all people of Chicago.

P33 is committed to reclaiming Chicago's position as the World's Brightest Spot for technological discovery and development. We are a team of thinkers and doers – business and community leaders, entrepreneurs, educators, technology experts and policymakers – who represent today's establishment and tomorrow's vanguard. Our work is focused on the key areas that will drive the future of Chicago's technology leadership: Talent & Education, Capital & Finullce, Business, Community & Culture, and Government & Infrastructure. Together, we're harnessing the spirit of technological innovation that lives in Chicago to drive momentum for businesses, both emerging and established, as well as for all people of Chicago.

The mission of People of Color Code is to create an environment for people of color to advance their software development and design skills through peer-led education, working on technical projects, collaborating with others, and networking

PWC is a national nonprofit organization founded in 1980 to support, advance, and connect women and promote diversity in the architecture, engineering, construction, and related fields. Fourteen industry leaders in Chicago came together in 2021 to extend that mission to the first midwestern chapter. Our vision is implemented by actively engaging our members in career development, hosting events that facilitate connection and foster open conversation, and providing leadership opportunities on member-driven committees. We welcome all genders in our membership - together we can do more to support women in our industry!

PWC is a national nonprofit organization founded in 1980 to support, advance, and connect women and promote diversity in the architecture, engineering, construction, and related fields. Fourteen industry leaders in Chicago came together in 2021 to extend that mission to the first midwestern chapter. Our vision is implemented by actively engaging our members in career development, hosting events that facilitate connection and foster open conversation, and providing leadership opportunities on member-driven committees. We welcome all genders in our membership - together we can do more to support women in our industry!

The mission of iBIO Institute’s PROPEL Center is to increase the number and success rates of life sciences start-ups in Illinois. PROPEL helps guide the development of formation-stage and early-stage life sciences companies by providing entrepreneurs with access to specialized resources and expertise to prepare them for early-stage funding.

Pumping Station: One is a hackerspace located on the north side of Chicago. There is a wide variety of members: artists, engineers, and enthusiasts of every description. Many events are open to the public: check out the PS1 calendar for details. PS:One is a member-run, member-organized 501(c)(3) with two tiers of membership; voting Full Members at $70 and non-voting Starving Hackers at $40. All major decisions, purchases and changes to the nature of the organization are done by a vote of the membership.

The mission of PS1 is to facilitate creativity in and through the intersection of art, technology, and culture.

PyData Chicago is a monthly meetup to discuss all things python (or R, Julia, C++, Rust, Go, ...) and data! Our meetup is now hybrid! Enjoy the event in person or virtually, hosted on Zoom. We usually meet on the last Thursday of the month.

organizations.Organization: Quantum Computer Chicago Illinois and Beyond
organizations.Description: It's about the qubits. Study eigenvectors and complex numbers!

Queer Tech Club is a monthly happy hour event that gets LGBTQ technology professionals from throughout the Chicago area together for networking, socializing and exchanging ideas. Each Meetup includes time for members to pitch their startup ideas, talk about recent accomplishments or share something cool they're working on. Event sponsors also share company news, employment opportunities and their latest technology innovations.
React Chicago is focused on bringing everyone together who have an interest in React, React Native, and its ecosystem. Be prepared to learn a lot and meet great people from the community!

organizations.Organization: SignalWire Code and Connect AI Low Code and Networking
organizations.Description: Our meetup group offers a refreshing approach to networking with like-minded tech professionals in a relaxed and enjoyable environment.

Join us for a laid-back gathering for tech professionals in the heart of Chicago. Whether you're a seasoned coder, a tech enthusiast, or just looking to make new connections in the industry, this is the perfect place to unwind and chat about everything from the latest tech trends to fun summer activities in the city.

organizations.Organization: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers (SHPE) - Region 6
organizations.Description: SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize its fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support, and development.

organizations.Organization: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers (SHPE) - Region 6
organizations.Description: SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize its fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support, and development.

As one of the largest SWE sections, we strive to provide members and partners with valuable programs and networking opportunities. We want to inspire women to achieve their full potential as engineers and leaders and help them as they seek to be their authentic selves in all stages of their careers and lives. Whether you are interested in professional development, outreach, or networking with fellow women engineers, SWE-CRS has something for you.

As one of the largest SWE sections, we strive to provide members and partners with valuable programs and networking opportunities. We want to inspire women to achieve their full potential as engineers and leaders and help them as they seek to be their authentic selves in all stages of their careers and lives. Whether you are interested in professional development, outreach, or networking with fellow women engineers, SWE-CRS has something for you.

We are a group of makers and hackers who came together to create a hackerspace on the south side of Chicago (in the Bridgeport and Pilsen area, where many of us live). We are seeking hackers, tinkerers, hobbyists, crafters, artists and doers to help us create a social, educational and collaborative space for ourselves and the community.

StartOut accelerates the growth of the LGBTQ+ community to drive its economic empowerment, building a world where every LGBTQ+ entrepreneur has equal access to lead, succeed, and shape the workforce of the future.

StartOut accelerates the growth of the LGBTQ+ community to drive its economic empowerment, building a world where every LGBTQ+ entrepreneur has equal access to lead, succeed, and shape the workforce of the future.
Startup Grind is the largest independent startup community, actively educating, inspiring, and connecting entrepreneurs globally in partnership with Google for Startups.

organizations.Organization: Tech In Motion - Has Chicago chapter

organizations.Description: Tech Salon Chicago is for anyone in the Tech, Design and Marketing fields to come learn, teach, discuss, empathize with various topics revolving around tech and design for the greater good. Each event will be different as we build and grow a networking community around our endeavors and the ethics around them.

Building products as a team requires people at its core. All the advanced technology and modern agile frameworks won't save you from the (often) awkward experience of working with others especially when you're accustomed to working on your own and meeting occasionally with other technologists.

organizations.Organization: UIUC (University of Illinois @ Urbana-Champaign) - MCS Chicago Campus

organizations.Description: We are a registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization. Our mission is to empower Ukrainian IT specialists in Chicago to succeed in their new home by providing resources, support, and networking opportunities while also fostering diversity and innovation in the local community through the unique skills and perspectives of our members.

UniForum Chicago is a non-profit organization that holds monthly informative and technical discussions every fourth Tuesday from 6:30pm to 8:30pm. This provides a local forum in the Chicago area for open systems and UNIX discussion and allows us to meet with students and other professionals in the field.

organizations.Organization: Data Science Institute, The University of Chicago
organizations.Description: The Data Science Institute (DSI) executes the University of Chicago’s bold, innovative vision of Data Science as a new discipline. The DSI seeds research on the interdisciplinary frontiers of this emerging field, forms partnerships with industry, government, and social impact organizations, and supports holistic data science education.

Come hang with us every month for UX book chats and socializing. If you're into human-centered design, HCI, product design, etc, we'd love for you to join us. Each month, we pick a book or article to dive into, post it here, and meet in person to talk about it. Give it a read, or just skim if you're short on time — no pressure! All are welcome to connect with our Chicago UX community.

UX Synergies is a Chicago based, volunteer run organization that enables discussions about UX, CX, AI and the world of digital design. We invite members who are involved in UX design, visual design, UX research, product development, AI, and customer experience to join our in person events to learn from and network with each other.
VRAR Chicago brings together people who are interested in working with virtual and augmented reality technology.
Chicago's Oldest Linux Users Group meets once a month to discuss all things Linux.

WiDS Chicago is independently organized by local ambassadors of Women in Data Science Worldwide to be part of the mission to increase participation of women in data science and to feature outstanding women doing outstanding work.

WiDS Chicago is independently organized by local ambassadors of Women in Data Science Worldwide to be part of the mission to increase participation of women in data science and to feature outstanding women doing outstanding work.
